channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+1428] Jon Stewart Slams Media Over Ground Zero Mosque (Videos)
item.description: Jon Stewart and the Daily Show report on the craze that's sweeping the entire nation: opposing new mosques.

item.title: [+1382] Reagan insider: GOP destroyed economy
item.description: How my G.O.P. destroyed the U.S. economy. Yes, that is exactly what David Stockman, President Ronald Reagan's director of the Office of Management and Budget, wrote in a recent New York Times op-ed piece, 'Four Deformations of the Apocalypse.'

item.title: [+1377] When to use i.e. in a sentence - The Oatmeal
item.description: A grammar guide explaining when to use i.e.

item.title: [+1296] Who Said the Parallel Port Was Dead? [PIC]
item.description: I don't know if this parallel DB25 to serial DE9 to serial Mini DIN-8 to USB converting ghetto chain works, but a reader says it does, and I really, really want to believe him.

item.title: [+1084] Anderson Cooper Interviews Horrid Texas Bigot: Video
item.description: Texas Republican state legislator Rep. Debbie Riddle was not prepared for Anderson Cooper Tuesday night. item.title: [+1081] 6 Movie Plots That Could Have Been Solved In Minutes
item.description: Writing movies is hard. Mainly because you, the audience, are so demanding. That's why we end up with such convoluted plots as these.

item.title: [+929] How to Start a Fight in Wisconsin (PIC)
[+891] Staff tackles and chokes deaf shopper
item.description: This is what I know, The two guys who are deaf were in the Clothing store XXI and apparently they were shopping, Staff must have seen them do something to suspect them of stealing, but that doesn't have any support or facts.

item.title: [+867] Fish Hadouken! (GIF)
[+764] Different Between Rich and Poor
[+684] US Judge: OK to extract confessions by threatening rape
item.description: In one of the first military commissions held under the Obama administration, a US military judge has ruled that confessions obtained by threatening the subject with rape are admissible in court.

item.title: [+600] Exposing Top Secret America [Infographic]
item.description: The world changed dramatically on September 11, 2001. Innocence was lost, lack of security was exposed, and the people of the United States and the world turned to their government to make things safe again. As a result, many believe we’ve taken a turn for the worst.

item.title: [+588] Even little girls know they will eventually control us…[Pic]
[+535] Who wouldn't look at that?
[+519] Time Crisis - Ft. Andy Whitfield [Video]
item.description: They just don't make light gun games like they used to. Very special thanks to Andy Whitfield (Spartacus, from the show Spartacus) for taking time out of his busy schedule to spend an afternoon horsing around with plastic guns with some dudes on the internet!

item.title: [+516] DRM Doesn’t Work Because it Doesn't Increase Profits
item.description: The basic misunderstanding of companies is the reason why anti-piracy measures will never work as a means of increasing profits. Companies assume that if they decrease the ease w/ which people can pirate their game, they will increase their sales. But that is not the case. Most people will, if they can't download an illegal copy of a game, simply..

item.title: [+513] The Unparalleled Wisdom Of Beavis and Butt-Head
item.description: The year was 1993, and it seemed that all America wanted was some T.P. for its bunghole.

item.title: [+513] Bail out the post office on the big banks' dime
item.description: The U.S. has 307 million people. If each person received an average of just one credit card offer a month and mailed it back to the bank without a signed application, at a cost to the bank of 44 cents postage, U.S. consumers could transfer $135 million a month from the banks to the Postal Service.

item.title: [+506] Boyfriend Stabbed in the Balls; Bleeds to Death
item.description: His girlfriend stabbed him in the balls after catching him with someone else. Then her sister refused to call paramedics, letting him bleed to death.

item.title: [+484] Google Founders Had Shouting Match Over Decision to Go Evil
item.description: Much has been made in light of the company's involvement in China and privacy issues, about Google's slogan "don't be evil," but apparently, the decision to go over to the dark side (by targeting ads) was a major bone of contention between the founders.
